Just finished. This is one of the most Half Life 2 games in the Half Life sereis.
yes
Auch noch heute ist Half-Life 2 fÃ¼r mich eines der besten Spiele jemals!

No, the real secret is that Half-Life is truly the sum of its parts. It takes every element in this oh-so-predictable genre, re-examines it, improves it, and then meshes it with the rest to create a constantly surprising, internally consistent, and always entertaining game.
Here are some examples. How many games have you played where health packs, armor, ammo and guns are simply lying around as if some Power-Up Santa Claus had emptied the contents of his pack on the floor? You can almost hear the level designers saying to themselves, "Okay, a health pack would be a good item to put in this otherwise empty room."

In Half-Life, weapons and ammo are taken from dead soldiers or other logical places, like a weapons locker. Armor isn't lying around in the form of glowing icons or leather helmets--instead, you're wearing a battery-powered hazard suit, but since it's a fairly standard bit of equipment in this secret base, power outlets are conveniently scattered throughout the complex. Doing this makes the game world feel all that much more real. The more real it feels, the more the player is sucked into the game. This is called suspension of disbelief, and while few game developers seem to be aware of it, Valve is and they make it work for them, over and over.
great game. It's a Half Life game, like what do you expect?

Half Life 2 is probably one of the best first-person shooter games of all time. But you probably know that already. The game holds up extremely well for being made back in 2004. I will say that the graphics have aged a bit, though I'm sure they were amazing for the time. The voice acting/dialogue can also be pretty cheesy at times, but if you look beyond the dialogue and into the extremely disturbing lore of the half life universe then you will get some of the best environmental story-telling of all time.

A complete masterpiece of a game! You could call it a must buy, especially if you liked Half-Life 1!

btw play HL1 before you play this or you're missing out.

Now listen, I'm writing my 100% honest review about this game:

Pros: #1.  This game is absolutely fantastic and has limitless potential 
         #2.  The story is fantastic and make sure to play the original Half life 1 before playing this, no harm if                     
                 you  don't but it will be more interesting to play
         #3.  The combat is well balanced, sure there are some scripted sequences that can make you angry    
                 But other than that thereâ€™s no problem 
         #4.  You can play a lot of mods as well 
         
 Now, for the cons 
  
         #1: Locating some lambda boxes is quite difficult because in one chapter there wasn't a sign to indicate 
               one. 

   So if you do purchase this game, make sure you have a good time while playing this, explore the levels 
   carefully for some achievements and stuff and check out Episode 1 and 2 they are both awesome to play!

  My overall experience: FANTASTIC !

You already know that this game is an absolute gem. There's no praises to be said about it that have not been said already. The fights are great and always make you think about your environment at every moment and how you can use it to your advantage. Music always starts at the right time, and almost every track is memorable. The story is a classic you'll never forget, and the graphics still hold up today. The game can also run completely smooth on high graphical settings on lower-end laptops not meant for gaming in my experience, which is great for accessibility. Overall, with this game constantly going on sale for dirt-cheap and being worth the base price, if not more, definitely pick it up.

After I got over the N64, this was probably the first computer game I remember playing. Still enjoyable now, even with its â€œwhat the hell is going on?â€ storyline.

It's very fun, and has some of the best lore I've heard, but almost every single room is a puzzle. Ravenholme is basically a giant maze, and I had to noclip through some puzzles just to continue. It's very fun, though. I recommend this game to great pathfinders.
I like it. replayed it a few times. And now Rebecca won't stop beating me because I keep saying "welcome, welcome to city 17" everytime she comes back home after a "walk"

Shooter for all time. Revolutionary technologies in their time are impressive even now. The design of the dystopian post-apocalyptic world of Eastern Europe is breathtaking in its contrast of familiar places combined with monolithic alien elements of an alien nature. Masterful directing without a single cut-scene, the constant alternation of hundreds of different situations: from exploration and puzzles, to transport trips and hurricane shootouts. Unforgettable sound design and music. I hope this masterpiece will be reprinted for many generations to come.
